subject: Re: [junit] Making your manual mocks resistant to interface changes
msgSnippet: This can be a useful technique. As a side note, before using any hackery in tests, (and I m a shameless hackerer), I often find it worth listening to what the
messageBody:
This can be a useful technique.

As a side note, before using any hackery in tests, (and I'm a
shameless hackerer), I often find it worth listening to what the tests
are telling me. For example, you had a read-only interface for a
library of Books that was just fine for the current implementation of
the BookService class. Perhaps keeping a read-only interface would
make it clearer which clients needed to change the book collection,
and which just needed to read it.

David Saff
